681.quoteText:
2. Modifications to this Agreement

Tumblr reserves the right to modify this Agreement by (1) posting a revised Agreement on and/or through the Services and (2) providing notice to you that this Agreement has changed, generally via email where practicable, and otherwise through the Services (such as through a notification on your Tumblr Dashboard or in our mobile applications). Modifications will not apply retroactively. You are responsible for reviewing and becoming familiar with any modifications to this Agreement.

We may sometimes ask you to review and to explicitly agree to (or reject) a revised version of this Agreement. In such cases, modifications will be effective at the time of your agreement to the modified version of this Agreement. If you do not agree at that time, you are not permitted to use the Services.

In cases where we do not ask for your explicit agreement to a modified version of this Agreement, but otherwise provide notice as set forth above, the modified version of this Agreement will become effective fourteen days after we have posted the modified Agreement and provided you notification of the modifications. Your use of the Services following that period constitutes your acceptance of the terms and conditions of this Agreement as modified. If you do not agree to the modifications, you are not permitted to use, and should discontinue your use of, the Services.

Note that, if you have prepaid for any Paid Services (as defined below) prior to a modification of this Agreement, your use of such prepaid Paid Services is governed by the version of this Agreement in effect at the time Tumblr received your prepayment.
681.title: Terms may be changed at any time, but you will be notified.

tosdr.case: The terms may be changed at any time, but you will receive notification of the changes
tosdr.tldr: They can change the terms of service any time they see fit, but they will notify the user. Your use of the service supposedly constitutes acceptance of the changes in the terms.

876.quoteText: You retain ownership you have of any intellectual property you post to Tumblr.
876.title: You maintain ownership of your Tumblr content

tosdr.case: You maintain ownership of your content
tosdr.tldr: Users maintain ownership of any content on their Tumblr. This is important because of the reblogging nature of Tumblr. Your content can be shared across numerous pages, but you will always own it.

965.quoteText: Agents with whom we share such information for these reasons are generally bound by confidentiality obligations and, unless we tell you differently, our agents do not have any right to use information we share with them beyond the scope and duration of what is necessary to assist us
965.title: Third parties used by Tumblr are bound by confidentiality obligations

tosdr.case: Third parties used by the service are bound by confidentiality obligations
tosdr.tldr: Third parties that assist Tumblr are generally bound by confidentiality obligations that forbid them to use your personal information for other purposes.

1015.quoteText:
19.
Special Provisions for Subscribers Located Outside of the United States
1015.title: Tumblr has provisions for users outside the US

tosdr.case: The court of law governing the terms is in location X
tosdr.tldr: Your data is stored in the US, and people from a country embargoed by the United States cannot use premium themes.

1048.quoteText: We're also going to make it a practice to post old versions so it's easy to see changes/additions/deletions. To see old versions, scroll down to the end of this document.
1048.title: Tumblr provides access to previous TOS and privacy policy

tosdr.case: Archives of their agreements are provided so that changes can be viewed over time
tosdr.tldr: They provide transparency on how the current policies differ from earlier versions, and when they changed.

1254.quoteText:
A web tag is code or a pixel embedded in a web page, or email, that allows Tumblr or a third party to see that you have looked at that page.
We use cookies and web tags to enable our servers to recognize your web browser and tell us how and when you use the Services, as described above in “Information Related to Use of the Services.” Our cookies do not, by themselves, contain information that personally identifies you, and we don't combine the general information collected through cookies with other such information to tell us who you are.
However, we do use cookies to identify that you have logged in, and that your web browser has accessed the Services, and we may associate that information with your Account if you have one.
1254.title: The cookies used by this service do not contain information that would personally identify you

tosdr.case: The cookies used by this service do not contain information that would personally identify you
tosdr.tldr: Web-browser information that's stored by Tumblr's cookies isn't used to identify you personally.

1329.quoteText:
Tumblr retains the right to create limits on and related to use of the Services in its sole discretion at any time with or without notice.
Tumblr may also impose limits on certain Services or aspects of those Services or restrict your access to parts or all of the Services without notice or liability.
Tumblr may change, suspend, or discontinue any or all of the Services at any time, including the availability of any product, feature, database, or Content (as defined below).
Tumblr may also terminate or suspend Accounts (as defined below) at any time, in its sole discretion.
1329.title: Tumblr can limit, restrict, suspend Services at any time without prior notice

tosdr.case: They may stop providing the service at any time

1347.quoteText:
Deleting your Account may not fully remove the content you have published from our systems, as caching of, backups of, copies of, or references to your Account Information may not be immediately removed.
In addition, given the nature of sharing on the Services, some of the public activity on your Account prior to deletion (such as reblogs of your blog posts) may remain stored on our servers and accessible to the public.
1347.title: Copies of your content may remain indefinitely on Tumblr's systems

tosdr.case: This service holds onto content that you've deleted

20044.quoteText: to use, host, store, cache, reproduce, publish, display (publicly or otherwise), perform (publicly or otherwise), distribute, transmit, modify, adapt (including, without limitation, in order to conform it to the requirements of any networks, devices, services, or media through which the Services are available)

20045.quoteText: Note also that this license to your Subscriber Content continues even if you stop using the Services, primarily because of the social nature of Content shared through Tumblr’s Services - when you post something publicly, others may choose to comment on it, making your Content part of a social conversation that can’t later be erased without retroactively censoring the speech of others.
20045.title: The copyright license you grant never expires, but it makes sense for this service

tosdr.case: You cannot delete your contributions, but it makes sense for this service

Services Available on an "AS IS" Basis

20053.quoteText: Tumblr may terminate or suspend your access to or ability to use any and all Services immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason or no reason, including but not limited to if you breach any of the terms or conditions of this Agreement.

20055.title: Details are provided about what kind of information they collect

20056.quoteText: You can keep yourself fairly anonymous on Tumblr, but remember that your posts, blogs, pages, and username are all visible to the public by default.
20056.title: Pseudonyms are allowed

tosdr.case: Pseudonyms are allowed

20057.quoteText:
People that know your email address can also find your blogs.
If you’d rather be unlisted, head over to your Account Settings.
20057.title: You can choose with whom you share content

tosdr.case: You can choose with whom you share content

20058.quoteText: We also may send you other kinds of emails, which you can opt-out of either from your Account Settings page or by using the “Opt-Out” link in the emails themselves.
20058.title: You can opt out of promotional communications

tosdr.case: You can opt out of promotional communications

20059.quoteText: In some cases, we partner with Third Party Services that may provide information about you.
20059.title: Information is gathered about you through third parties

tosdr.case: Information is gathered about you through third parties

20060.quoteText: We use information about native actions to improve the Services, develop new Services, and, particularly, to personalize your Tumblr experience. Personalization using this information may include presenting you with new posts relevant to what you’ve liked, providing you with better search results, and showing you advertising more relevant to your interests.
20060.title: Your personal data is used for advertising

tosdr.case: Your personal data is used for advertising

20061.quoteText: Reblogs, Likes, and Replies are a matter of public record, so if you’re truly ashamed of your desires it’s best to keep them to yourself. But why? Be proud of who you are. You’re beautiful. We’re looking you in the eyes and telling you how beautiful you are.
20061.title: The terms for this service are easy to read

tosdr.case: The terms for this service are easy to read
tosdr.tldr: Despite being long, the agreements define well the legalese and employ an understandable language.

20062.quoteText: We will sometimes collect financial information, such as information related to your payment method (valid credit card number, type, expiration date or other financial information). This happens when you decide to purchase a paid Service. We do not, however, store that financial information. such information is stored by our payment processor (the "Payment Processor"), and use and storage of that information is governed by the Payment Processor’s applicable terms of service and privacy policy (the Payment Processor may also have other terms, and you are responsible for locating and familiarizing yourself with those terms, as applicable).
20062.title: This service gives your personal data to third parties involved in its operation

tosdr.case: This service gives your personal data to third parties involved in its operation

20063.quoteText: We use internal tools and third party applications and services (like Google Analytics or comScore) to collect and analyze this information.
20063.title: Third-party cookies are used for statistics

tosdr.case: Third-party cookies are used for statistics

20064.quoteText: Some of this information may also be associated with the Internet Protocol Address (“IP Address”) used to access the Services.
20064.title: Your IP address is collected, which can be used to view your approximate location

tosdr.case: Your IP address is collected, which can be used to view your approximate location

20065.quoteText: We automatically receive and record information from your web browser when you interact with the Services, such as your browser type and version, what sort of device you are using, your operating system and version, your language preference, the website or service that referred you to the Services
20065.title: This service tracks which web page referred you to it

tosdr.case: This service tracks which web page referred you to it

20066.title: Tracking pixels are used in service-to-user communication

tosdr.case: Tracking pixels are used in service-to-user communication

20067.quoteText:
In order to provide you with all of this Tumblr content for free, Tumblr selectively runs advertisements.
We, and our parent company, Automattic, work with online advertising companies to provide you with advertising that is as relevant and useful as possible.
To make our ads more relevant and useful, we make educated guesses about your interests based on your activity on our sites and services.
20067.title: Your personal data is used to employ targeted third-party advertising

tosdr.case: Your personal data is used to employ targeted third-party advertising

20068.quoteText:
If you do not prefer personalized advertising experiences, you may opt-out. Note that if you opt-out you will continue to see advertisements on Tumblr, though they will be less relevant and useful to you.

When using web-based versions of Tumblr, you may opt-out of interest-based or personalized advertising by using the following industry opt-out pages:

  • (EU) European Interactive Digital Advertising Alliance (EDAA) - www.youronlinechoices.com
  • (US) Network Advertising Initiative (NAI) - www.networkadvertising.org
  • (US) Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) - www.aboutads.info
  • (Japan) Data Driven Advertising Initiative (DDAI) - www.ddai.info
20068.title: You can opt out of targeted advertising

tosdr.case: You can opt out of targeted advertising

20069.quoteText: Information Disclosed Pursuant to Business Transfers: In some cases, we may choose to buy or sell business assets. In these transactions, user information is typically one of the transferred business assets. Moreover, if we, or substantially all of our assets, were acquired, or if we go out of business or enter bankruptcy, user information would be one of the assets that is transferred or acquired by a third party.
20069.title: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction

tosdr.case: Your personal data may be sold or otherwise transferred as part of a bankruptcy proceeding or other type of financial transaction

20070.quoteText: You acknowledge that such transfers may occur, and that any acquirer of us or our assets may continue to use your Personal Information as set forth in this policy.
20070.title: Promises will be kept after a merger or acquisition

tosdr.case: Promises will be kept after a merger or acquisition

20071.quoteText: That said, we also reserve the right to access, preserve, and disclose any information as we reasonably believe is necessary, in our sole discretion, to (i) satisfy any law, regulation, legal process, governmental request, or governmental order, (ii) enforce this Privacy Policy and our Terms of Service, including investigation of potential violations hereof, (iii) detect, prevent, or otherwise address fraud, security, trust and safety, or technical issues (including exchanging information with other companies and organizations for the purposes of improving security and preventing fraud, spam, and malware), (iv) respond to user support requests, or (v) protect the rights, property, health or safety of us, our users, any third parties or the public in general, including but not limited to situations involving possible violence, suicide, or self-harm.
20071.title: The service will only respond to government requests that are reasonable

tosdr.case: The service will only respond to government requests that are reasonable

20072.quoteText: Tumblr will retain your information only for as long as is necessary for the purposes set out in this Privacy Policy, for as long as your Tumblr account is active or as needed to provide you with the Services.
20072.title: The data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes

tosdr.case: The data retention period is kept to the minimum necessary for fulfilling its purposes

20073.title: The service claims to be CCPA compliant for California users
